title: Protein Ligand Data Analysis
text:
This website discusses the impact of mutations in protein-ligand formations, specifically their affinities. A ligand is a protein that binds to a target protein, and their interaction can be measured and described in terms of the forces involved in their bonding, concentration, and energy used up!
This science of these interaction is crucial for drug and material sciences. The study used to conduct this analysis were measured across different scales, such as trajectory in space, and time, and used geometric features in molecules through simulations to determine how drug-resistant mutations form, building a foundation for understanding how molecular dynamics simulations can be used to understand randomness in biophysics.
The graph below showcases the relationship between the impact of various genes and their fold change, which helps understand the resilience of protein-ligand structures under various conditions:

title: About
text:
Hey,
My name is Nithura and I’m an engineering student at the University of Toronto, based in Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
To view more about the project and any of my other ones, feel free to visit my github account at link below, and feel free to contact be my email to answer any other questions.
Stay analytical, Nithura :)

title: Sources
text:
Chatgpt:
Chatgpt was used for understanding characteristics in the dataset of different variables, and the types of significant patterns between the observations and their potential impact in the field of biophysics.
Google Dataset Search:
The dataset was sourced from Google Dataset search to understand how simulations were being applied in understanding proteins and, in a broader sense, how the formation of mutations affect our understanding of their capabilities.
